This function is called internally in the application's main loop and does not need to be called explicitly.
@description Render the application's scene. More specifically, the scene's {@link LayerComposition} is rendered by the application's {@link ForwardRenderer}.
@param {GraphicsDevice} [graphicsDevice] - The graphics device used to manage this layer composition. If it is not provided, a device is obtained
@classdesc Layer Composition is a collection of {@link Layer} that is fed to {@link Scenelayers} to define rendering order.
Layers are organized inside {@link LayerComposition} in a desired order.
@param {object} options - Object for passing optional arguments. These arguments are the same as properties of the Layer.

@classdesc Layer represents a renderable subset of the scene. It can contain a list of mesh instances, lights and cameras, their render settings and also defines custom callbacks before, after or during rendering.

@classdesc Layer represents a renderable subset of the scene. It can contain a list of mesh instances, lights and cameras, their render settings and also defines custom callbacks before, after or during rendering. Layers are organized inside {@link LayerComposition} in a desired order.
@property {Asset[]|number[]} materialAssets The material assets that will be used to render the meshes. Each material corresponds to the respective mesh instance.
@property {Asset|number} asset The render asset for the render component (only applies to type 'asset') - can also be an asset id.
@classdesc Enables an Entity to render a {@link Mesh} or a primitive shape. This component attaches {@link MeshInstance} geometry to the Entity.
@param {object} [data] - The initialization data for the specific component type. Refer to each specific component's API reference page for details on valid values for this parameter.
